meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unable to be removed or taken away.
meanings.sent1: The irremovability of the giant boulder made it impossible to clear the path.
meanings.sent2: The irremovability of the stain on the carpet frustrated the homeowner.
meanings.sent3: The irremovability of the stubborn sticker on the jar became a comical challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her loyalty to the team was like the irremovability of a mountain in the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The irremovability of the ancient tree in the forest was a symbol of strength and endurance.

meanings.definition: The condition of being permanent or unchangeable.
meanings.sent1: The irremovability of the historical monument ensured its preservation for future generations.
meanings.sent2: The irremovability of the rule was a source of stability in the community.
meanings.sent3: The irremovability of the 'no pets allowed' sign led to some creative interpretations.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was as certain as the irremovability of the North Star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The irremovability of the ancient ruins spoke of a civilization long forgotten.
